q: Today is plenty; right now is enough. Tomorrow will come in good time. Until it does, live the depth of now.
h:
“Today is plenty; right now is enough. Tomorrow will come in good time. Until it does, live the depth of now.” —
Ralph Marston

q: Forget yesterday - it has already forgotten you. Don't sweat tomorrow - you haven't even met. Instead, open your eyes and your heart to a truly precious gift - today.
h:
“Forget yesterday - it has already forgotten you. Don't sweat tomorrow - you haven't even met. Instead, open your eyes and your heart to a truly precious gift - today.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Remember, today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday.
h:
“Remember, today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: The consequences of today are determined by the actions of the past. To change your future, alter your decisions today.
h:
“The consequences of today are determined by the actions of the past. To change your future, alter your decisions today.” —
Unknown

q: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Your life will never be the same again.
h:
“Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Your life will never be the same again.” —
Og Mandino

q: Work as though you would live forever, and live as though you would die today. Go another mile.
h:
“Work as though you would live forever, and live as though you would die today. Go another mile.” —
Og Mandino

q: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.
h:
“Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.” —
Joan Rivers

q: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.
h:
“What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.” —
Ralph Marston

q: You are today where your thoughts have brought you.
h:
“You are today where your thoughts have brought you.” —
James Allen

q: Hope is important because it can make the present moment less difficult to bear. If we believe that tomorrow will be better, we can bear a hardship today.
h:
“Hope is important because it can make the present moment less difficult to bear. If we believe that tomorrow will be better, we can bear a hardship today.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: You Create Your Own Present By What You Give Your Attention To Today.
h:
“You Create Your Own Present By What You Give Your Attention To Today.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today.
h:
“Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Make your stand today. On this spot. On this day.
h:
“Make your stand today. On this spot. On this day.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: The future depends on what you do today.
h:
“The future depends on what you do today. ” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: Yesterday is but today's memory, tomorrow is today's dream.
h:
“Yesterday is but today's memory, tomorrow is today's dream.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: The goal is not to be perfect by the end, the goal is to be better today.
h:
“The goal is not to be perfect by the end, the goal is to be better today.” —
Simon Sinek

q: We know nothing of tomorrow, our business is to be good and happy today.
h:
“We know nothing of tomorrow, our business is to be good and happy today.” —
Sydney Smith

q: Perhaps the most tragic thing about mankind is that we are all dreaming about some magical garden over the horizon, instead of enjoying the roses that are right outside today.
h:
“Perhaps the most tragic thing about mankind is that we are all dreaming about some magical garden over the horizon, instead of enjoying the roses that are right outside today.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: What have you done today to make someone else happy?
h:
“What have you done today to make someone else happy?” —
Deepam Chaterjee

q: A man should never be ashamed to own that he has been in the wrong, which is but saying, that he is wiser today than yesterday.
h:
“A man should never be ashamed to own that he has been in the wrong, which is but saying, that he is wiser today than yesterday.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: The beautiful journey of today can only begin when we learn to let go of yesterday.
h:
“The beautiful journey of today can only begin when we learn to let go of yesterday.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Looking after my health today gives me a better hope for tomorrow.
h:
“Looking after my health today gives me a better hope for tomorrow. ” —
Anne Wilson Schaef

q: Today is the oldest you've ever been, and the youngest you'll ever be again.
h:
“Today is the oldest you've ever been, and the youngest you'll ever be again.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: I am who I am today because of the choices I made yesterday.
h:
“I am who I am today because of the choices I made yesterday.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: We crave for new sensations but soon become indifferent to them. The wonders of yesterday are today common occurrences
h:
“We crave for new sensations but soon become indifferent to them. The wonders of yesterday are today common occurrences ” —
Nikola Tesla

q: Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.
h:
“Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: Today will never happen again. Don't waste it with a false start or no start at all.
h:
“Today will never happen again. Don't waste it with a false start or no start at all.” —
Og Mandino

q: Forget mistakes. Forget failure. Forget everything except what you are going to do now and do it. Today is your lucky day!
h:
“Forget mistakes. Forget failure. Forget everything except what you are going to do now and do it. Today is your lucky day!” —
Og Mandino

q: Every night before going to sleep, we must ask ourselves: what weakness did I overcome today? What virtue did I acquire?
h:
“Every night before going to sleep, we must ask ourselves: what weakness did I overcome today? What virtue did I acquire?” —
Seneca

q: Today you are you, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is you-er than you.
h:
“Today you are you, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is you-er than you.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: Yesterday is the past, tomorrow is the future, today is a gift - that's why it's called the present.
h:
“Yesterday is the past, tomorrow is the future, today is a gift - that's why it's called the present.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: A tiny change today brings a dramatically different tomorrow.
h:
“A tiny change today brings a dramatically different tomorrow.” —
Richard Bach

q: Today I begin a new life. I will greet this day with love in my heart.
h:
“Today I begin a new life. I will greet this day with love in my heart.” —
Og Mandino

q: Don't Let Yesterday Take Up Too Much Of Today.
h:
“Don't Let Yesterday Take Up Too Much Of Today.” —
Will Rogers
